title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 § 1211.10 - Combustible liquids
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 § 1211.10 - Combustible liquids

State Regulations
(a) Combustible
liquids are not restricted, when in containers of 55 gallons capacity or less. Containers which have a capacity of greater than 55 gallons are subject to the
same restrictions that are applied to tank vehicles (see (b) and (c)
below). (b) No tank vehicle, loaded
or empty, shall enter either a tunnel, the George Washington Bridge Lower Level
or George Washington Bridge Expressway if the vehicle is used in the
transportation of any combustible liquid which has a flash point at or below 95
degrees Fahrenheit; nor shall any empty tank vehicle be allowed passage if it
contains a residue of cut-back tar or any substance thinned with a combustible
liquid solvent which has a flash point at or below 95 degrees

Fahrenheit. (c) Tank vehicles
transporting combustible liquids which have a flash point above 95 degrees

Fahrenheit are permitted passage provided the shipping paper bears the
notation, "FLASH POINT ABOVE 95° F."
Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21
§
1211.10

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
